topic.title: Replacing or Removing a License Key in an HTTP License Server

body.p: The following procedure assumes that your HTTP license server contains a previously activated license key and provides instructions for replacing it with another one or removing it completely.
This is useful if, for instance, you want to upgrade your existing license to the latest version or if you receive a new license key that accommodates a different number of users.

section.title: Finding the URL of the License Server
section.p: To find the URL of the License Server that is currently being used, go to the Web Author Administration page and select License. In the License Server section, click on the license server link. Then log in using the License Server's admin user credentials.

section.title: Replacing a License Key
section.p:
To replace a license key that is activated on your HTTP license server with a new one, follow these steps:
Access the license server by following the link provided by the Tomcat Web Application Manager page and log in using your admin credentials.
Click the Replace/Remove license key link. This will open a page that contains details about the license currently in use.
Click the Replace button.
Paste the new license key in the displayed form.
Click Register/Activate. The browser used in the process needs to have Internet access.This will bind the license key to your License Server instance.
Step Result: You will be redirected to an online form hosted on the Oxygen website. This form is pre-filled with an activation code that uniquely identifies your license server deployment and your license key.If you cannot access the online activation form, you can manually activate the license key.

Result: If the activation process is completed successfully, your license server is now running using the new license key. You can click View license key to inspect the key currently used by the license server.

section.title: Removing a License Key
section.p:
To remove a license key that is activated on your HTTP license server, follow these steps:
Access the license server by following the link provided by the Tomcat Web Application Manager page and log in using your admin credentials.
Click the Replace/Remove license key link. This will open a page that contains details about the license currently in use.
Click the Remove button to begin the license deletion procedure.
Click the Remove button in the confirmation page. The removal process is irreversible. Once the process is complete, you cannot restore the license key.
